intro: Hemizonia congesta subsp. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, which is typical of the family. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for various pollinators.
